key_points: Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Tom Brady, at 44, claims he could play in the NFL till 50 or 55.
Brady has led Tampa to a Super Bowl title and is off to an historic start to the 2021 season.
He is on pace to break season records for completions, attempts, and passing yards.
Brady believes his physical condition would not hinder his longevity in the sport.
He acknowledges, however, that choosing to play that long might mean missing out on family life.
Brady's performance in his 40s is unprecedented, nearing more touchdowns in his 40s than in his 20s.
Comparison with other NFL quarterbacks like Peyton Manning and Drew Brees shows their careers declined due to age.
Tom Brady does not see himself following the decline in performance due to age.
It is suggested Brady might retire while still at the peak of his career rather than due to a decline.
The NFL's oldest player, George Blanda, retired at 48, transitioning to less physically demanding positions.
